name: Beasley v. Food Fair of North Carolina, Inc.
Commissioner of Internal Revenue v. Idaho Power Company
United States v. Giordano
question: Is the Attorney General or a designated Assistant Attorney General allowed to delegate the power to authorize wiretap applications to an Executive Assistant?
description: A case in which the Court held that evidence obtained from improperly authorized wiretap applications, along with any evidence obtained from extensions of those applications, must be suppressed.

name: Federal Power Commission v. New England Power Company
United States v. Nixon
question: Is the President's right to safeguard certain information, using his "executive privilege" confidentiality power, entirely immune from judicial review?
description: A case in which the Court held that the President does not have executive privilege in immunity from subpoenas or other civil court actions.

name: United States v. Marine Bancorporation, Inc.
National Labor Relations Board v. Savair Manufacturing Company
Bangor Punta Operations, Inc. v. Bangor & Aroostook Railroad Company
Oneida Indian Nation of New York v. County of Oneida, New York
Milliken v. Bradley
question: Did federal courts have the authority to impose a multi-district desegregation plan on schools outside the Detroit area?

name: Secretary of the Navy v. Avrech
United States v. Matlock
question:
(1) Does a third party with control over a space have authority to consent to a search?

(2) Were the woman’s statements that she lived with Matlock inadmissible hearsay?

name: Phillips Petroleum Company v. Texaco Inc.
Baker v. Gold Seal Liquors, Inc.
Communist Party of Indiana v. Whitcomb
question: Does Indiana’s policy requiring any new political party to file a loyalty oath signed by its officers violate the First and Fourteenth Amendments?
description: A case in which the Court held that Indiana’s policy requiring any new political party to file a loyalty oath signed by its officers violate the First and Fourteenth Amendments.

name: Wolff v. McDonnell
question: Do the disciplinary proceedings at Nebraska Penal and Correctional Center violate the Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment?

name: Geduldig v. Aiello
question: Did Section 2626 of California's Unemployment Insurance Code violate the Equal Protection Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment?

name: United States v. Calandra
question: Can a witness refuse to answer questions before a grand jury when the questions are based on evidence obtained during a search that the witness feels is unlawful?

name: United States v. Richardson
question: Does a federal taxpayer have standing to force the government to disclose expenditures of the CIA?

name: Jenkins v. Georgia
question: Did the manager's conviction violate the First and Fourteenth Amendments?

name: Cooper Stevedoring Company, Inc. v. Fritz Kopke, Inc.
Granny Goose Foods, Inc. v. Teamsters
United States v. Connecticut National Bank
Windward Shipping (London) Ltd. v. American Radio Association, AFL-CIO
Schlesinger v. Reservists Committee to Stop the War
National Labor Relations Board v. Food Store Employees Union, Local 347, Amalgamated Meat Cutters & Butcher Workmen of North America, AFL-CIO
F.D. Rich Company, Inc. v. United States for the Use of Industrial Lumber Company
Calero-Toledo v. Pearson Yacht Leasing Company
Cleveland Board of Education v. LaFleur
question:
1. Did both school boards' policies terminating teachers' employment in their fourth or fifth month of pregnancy violate the Fourteenth Amendment?

2. Did the Cleveland School Board's policy preventing LaFleur and Nelson from returning to work until their children were three months old violate the Fourteenth Amendment?

3. Did the Chesterfield School Board's policy allowing Cohen to resume employment after maternity leave only upon submission of a certificate of medical health by her physician violate the Fourteenth Amendment?
description: A case in which the Court held that the school boards' regulations requiring pregnant teachers to stop working after the fifth month of their pregnancies violated the Fourteenth Amendment's due process clause.

name: William E. Arnold Company v. Carpenters District Council of Jacksonville and Vicinity
Howard Johnson Company, Inc. v. Detroit Local Joint Executive Board, Hotel & Restaurant Employees & Bartenders International Union, AFL-CIO
North Dakota Board of Pharmacy v. Snyder's Drug Stores, Inc.
Kahn v. Shevin
question: Does the Florida statute that only provides property tax exemptions to widows violate the Equal Protection Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment?
description: A case in which the Court held that the Florida statute that only provides property tax exemptions to widows violates the Equal Protection Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment.

name: Central Tablet Mfg. Company v. United States
Lewis v. City of New Orleans
Steffel v. Thompson
question:
Does the case present an actual and active controversy?

Can a federal court grant declaratory relief against the enforcement of a state statute when a criminal proceeding is pending?

name: National Cable Television Assn., Inc. v. United States
Commissioner of Internal Revenue v. National Alfalfa Dehydrating & Milling Company
Air Pollution Variance Board of Colorado v. Western Alfalfa Corporation
Mitchell v. W. T. Grant Company
question: Does sequestration of a debtor's property without providing the debtor notice or a hearing to defend an interest in the property violate the Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment?

name: National Labor Relations Board v. Magnavox Company of Tennessee
Golden State Bottling Company, Inc. v. National Labor Relations Board
Morton v. Mancari
question:
(1) Did the Equal Employment Opportunity Act of 1972 repeal Section 472 of the Indian Reorganization Act of 1934?

(2) Did Section 472 violate the due process clause of the Fifth Amendment?

name: United States v. General Dynamics Corporation
Kewanee Oil Company v. Bicron Corporation
Bradley v. School Board of the City of Richmond
Espinoza v. Farah Manufacturing Company, Inc.
Teleprompter Corporation v. Columbia Broadcasting System, Inc.
American Pipe & Construction Company v. Utah
question: Does dismissal of a class action lawsuit after the statute of limitations has expired prevents previous class members from either filing individual lawsuits against the defendant or otherwise joining an existing claim?
description: A case in which the Court held that commencing a class action suspends all applicable statutes of limitations against members of that class who would have been parties had the suit been allowed to continue as a class action.

name: Mayor of Philadelphia v. Educational Equality League
United States Immigration & Naturalization Service v. Hibi
American Party of Texas v. White
Davis v. United States
question: Was Davis entitled to challenge his conviction under 28 U.S.C. Section 2255?

name: Dillard v. Industrial Commission of Virginia
Spence v. Washington
question: Does the Washington statute violate the First and Fourteenth Amendments?

name: Miami Herald Publishing Company v. Tornillo
question: Did Florida Statute Section 104.38, the "right to reply" statute, violate the free press clause of the First Amendment applied to the states through the Fourteenth Amendment?

name: Christian v. New York Department Of Labor
Department of Game of Washington v. Puyallup Tribe
Florida Power & Light Company v. International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers, Local 641
Gertz v. Robert Welch Inc.
question: Does the First Amendment allow a newspaper or broadcaster to assert defamatory falsehoods about an individual who is neither a public official nor a public figure?
description: Private individuals need only prove negligence to recover in defamation suits against news media

name: City of Pittsburgh v. Alco Parking Corporation
Gateway Coal v. United Mine Workers of America
National Railroad Passenger Corporation v. National Association of Railroad Passengers
Village of Belle Terre v. Boraas
question: Does an ordinance restricting land use to “one-family” dwellings violate the Equal Protection Clause and Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment?
description: A case in which the Court held that an ordinance restricting land use to “one-family” dwellings did not violate the Equal Protection Clause or the Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment.

name: United States v. Robinson
question: Did the officer's search violate the Fourth Amendment?

name: Renegotiation Board v. Bannercraft Clothing Company, Inc.
Snow v. Commissioner of Internal Revenue
Super Tire Engineering Company v. McCorkle
Gerstein v. Pugh
question:
Does a person in state custody have a constitutional right to a preliminary hearing?
Does a U.S. District Court judge have jurisdiction to interfere in a state criminal proceeding on the question of preliminary hearings?
description: A case in which the Court held that the Fourth Amendment entitles a person arrested without a warrant and charged by information to a timely preliminary hearing on probable cause.

name: Procunier v. Martinez
question:
(1) Should a district court abstain from determining the constitutional validity of administrative rules established by the California Department of Corrections when there were state laws addressing the validity of such regulations?

(2) Does the Constitution compel California to give law students and legal paraprofessionals the full range of privileges accorded to attorneys in their meetings with inmates?

name: Lehman v. City of Shaker Heights
question: Did Shaker Heights' policy against political advertising on its streetcars violate the free speech clause of the First Amendment?

name: Kosydar v. National Cash Register Company
Lau v. Nichols
question: Does a school district violate the Fourteenth Amendment or the Civil Rights Act of 1964 when it teaches exclusively in English and fails to provide non-English speaking students with any supplemental English language classes?

name: Arnett v. Kennedy
question: May the federal government dismiss a nonprobationary employee without a trial-type preremoval hearing? Must the federal government provide sufficiently precise guidelines as to what kind of speech might be made the basis for a removal action?

name: Old Dominion Branch No. 496, National Association of Letter Carriers, AFL-CIO v. Austin
question: Does the First Amendment protect speech in labor dispute cases from the application of state libel laws?
description: A case in which the Court held that the First Amendment protects speech in labor dispute cases from the application of state libel laws.

name: Mobil Oil Corporation v. Federal Power Commission
Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc. v. Ware
DeFunis v. Odegaard
question: Was the case in question moot and therefore outside the scope of judicial review?

name: National Labor Relations Board v. Bell Aerospace Company
